summary: Clarence J. Day is listed as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) in payroll certifications from October 1977, November 1977, and May 1978. The documents provide details such as his position and salary during those periods. However, the specific role or responsibilities of Clarence J. Day within the HSCA are not detailed in these documents.
significance: The significance of Clarence J. Day lies in his employment within the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents confirm his employment, they do not provide enough information to determine the specific importance of his role in the investigation.
